title: Makefile fmt target fails when goimports not installed
description:
## Problem

Running `make all` or `make fmt` fails with:

```
make: goimports: No such file or directory
make: *** [fmt] Error 1
```

This happens when `goimports` is not installed or not in PATH.

## Suggested Fix

The Makefile should either:
1. Check for required tools and provide helpful error messages
2. Auto-install missing tools (e.g., `go install golang.org/x/tools/cmd/goimports@latest`)
3. Document required tools in README

## Workaround

Install goimports manually:
```bash
go install golang.org/x/tools/cmd/goimports@latest
```

Then ensure `~/go/bin` is in your PATH.
close_reason: Fixed by adding goimports as a tool dependency in go.mod and using 'go tool goimports' in Makefile

title: Configure command shows usage info on validation errors
description:
When configure fails (e.g., invalid secret key), it shows the usage info which is confusing. Should only show the error message.

Example:
```
Error: failed to validate secret key: token exchange failed: 400
Usage:
  pub configure [flags]

Flags:
      --account string   Default account UUID (optional)
  -h, --help             help for configure
```

Expected: Just show the error, not usage info.

Fix: Set `cmd.SilenceUsage = true` in the command to suppress usage on RunE errors.
close_reason: Added SilenceUsage = true to configure command

title: Error with setup instructions when CLI is unconfigured
description:
When user runs any command (quote, account, order, etc.) without having configured the CLI:

1. Check if secret key exists in keyring OR PUB_SECRET_KEY env var is set
2. If not configured, error out with clear message:
   'CLI not configured. Run: pub configure
    Or set PUB_SECRET_KEY environment variable.'
3. Do NOT auto-prompt - just error and exit

This keeps the UX simple and predictable:
- Interactive users: run 'pub configure' once
- CI/CD/scripts: set PUB_SECRET_KEY env var
